text:
67 million-- 67 million refugees
lives today are uncertain.

My own grandmother faced
down this uncertainty

when she was forced to leave
her beloved home of 60 years

from Damascus, Syria
because of the war.

In nearby Jordan, I
had the opportunity

to hear stories of
patients struggling

with this very same uncertainty,
patients like Hisham,

a seven-year-old Syrian
boy living in Jordan

with Type 1 diabetes
who nearly passed away

from a diabetic crisis
because neither he

nor his parents, nor
even his physicians,
knew that he had the disease.
They didn't know his story.

At Hikma Health,
we empower refugees

like his Hisham to create,
understand, and share
their health data story.

I'm Senan Ebrahim, founder
and CEO of Hikma Health.

And with our team of developers,
designers, and physicians,

we have created a free and open
source health data solution

for refugee care, validated
by our academic advisors
at Harvard Med.

We are deploying this platform
for 2 million Syrian refugees

right now, offering integrated
predictive analytics

to give them some certainty
in a healthier future.

With this $5,000, we
will be able to deploy

this platform for another 50,000
patients in another clinic.

So please join us in
building a new world in which

every single person,
refugee or otherwise,

enjoys access to smart,
personalized health care.
Thank you.
[APPLAUSE]
